verbs.description: particularize (third-person singular simple present particularizes, present participle particularizing, simple past and past participle particularized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make particular, as opposed to general; to restrict to a specific or individual case, class etc.; to single out.
(transitive, intransitive) To be specific about (individual instances); to go into detail (about), to specify.
(intransitive) To differentiate, make distinct from others.
